comment.body:
> user do not need to engage in any way with the cookie notices, the annoyances filter is supposed to remove them

I have already [explained](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/172879#issuecomment-1948438374) why it is necessary to refrain from accepting cookies. Besides, you also mentioned the same in the description. Just removing the cookies is not enough, you have to interact with them by refusing or accepting them.

> tweets are not displayed properly if you haven't accepted cookies

 > the annoyances filter is supposed to remove them

We have a rule for this and it works fine.
```adblock
protothema.gr#%#//scriptlet('trusted-click-element', '.qc-cmp2-summary-buttons > button[mode="secondary"] + button[mode="secondary"]')
```

---

You didn't answer my question.
